intro: Colymbada stereophylla, commonly known as the marsh holly. It is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae, characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. Native to wetland habitats in southern Africa, it thrives in moist, acidic soils. The plant has a compact growth habit with dark green leaves and produces white or pale pink blooms. It is often used in ornamental gardening for its aesthetic appeal and ability to tolerate waterlogged conditions.
